column2: One of a, b, or c (CharBit)

Chose one character, case sensitive, non-Unicode (CharDifference)

Chose one character, case insensitive, Unicode (CharDifference)

Chose one character outside a range (CharRange → CharRangeCompliment → CharDifference)

Matches consonants and the dash (Java does not do subtraction like this)

Match literal characters between \Q and \E (escape sequence)

Any letter except an uppercase letter (CharNames, CharCategory, CharCompliment, CharIntersection)

The end of a line (CharUnicode, End)

Quote the following character (Curly, Slice, CharRange)

Inline modifier i: case insensitive, ASCII (CharRangeInsensitive)
Inline modifier -i: not case insensitive, ASCII (GroupHead, GroupTail, SliceInsensistive, CharSingle)
Inline modifier i: case insensitive, ASCII (GroupHead, GroupTail, Slice, CharSingleInsensistive)
Inline modifier iU: case insensitive, Unicode (CharRangeUnicodeInsensitive)
Inline modifier -i: non-case insensitive, Unicode (GroupHead, GroupTail, CharSingleUnicodeInsensitive, CharSingle)
Inline modifier iU: case insensitive, Unicode (GroupHead, GroupTail, CharSingleUnicodeInsensitive, CharSingle)
Inline modifier m: multi-line mode on
Inline modifier -m: multi-line mode off (GroupHead, GroupTail, CharSingle)
Inline modifier m: multi-line mode on (GroupHead, GroupTail, CharSingle)
Inline modifier s: single-line mode on
Inline modifier -s: single-line mode off (GroupHead, GroupTail)
Inline modifier s: single-line mode on (GroupHead, GroupTail)
Inline modifier d: UNIX line mode on
Inline modifier d: UNIX line mode off (GroupHead, GroupTail)
Inline modifier d: UNIX line mode on (GroupHead, GroupTail)
Inline modifier iu: Unicode case on (only relevant with case-insensitive)
Inline modifier -iu: Unicode case off (GroupHead, GroupTail, CharSingleUnicodeInsensitive, CharSingle)
Inline modifier iu: Unicode case on (GroupHead, GroupTail, CharSingleUnicodeInsensitive, CharSingle)
Inline modifier c: canonical equivalence on
Inline modifier c: canonical equivalence off
Inline modifier c: canonical equivalence off then on
Inline modifier c: canonical equivalence on then off
Inline modifier x: free spacing mode on (ignore whitespace)
Inline modifier x: free spacing mode off
Inline modifier x: free spacing mode on then off
Inline modifier x: free spacing mode off then on
Inline modifier U: Unicode off then on

column1:
(?x)  ^       # match the beginning of the line
  (\w+)   # 1st capturing group: match one or more word characters
  \s      # match a whitespace character
  (\w+)   # 2nd capturing group: match one or more word characters

(?x   )  ^  Drop\ comment\ here,      # match the beginning of the line
  ((?-x) Respect space and hash \(#\) here,)
		\   # <-- escaped space
	Ignore \x  # <- start hex space
a2 0 gain # comment
